attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386 Mono/.Net assembly, for MS Windows

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when a file with a suspicious extension is created in the startup folder

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Credential Manager Access By Uncommon Applications
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects suspicious processes based on name and location that access the windows credential manager and vault.
Which can be a sign of credential stealing. Example case would be usage of mimikatz "dpapi::cred" function

Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
The data may also be sent to an alternate network location from the main command and control server.
A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious File Access to Browser Credential Storage
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects file access to browser credential storage paths by non-browser processes, which may indicate credential access attempts.
Adversaries may attempt to access browser credential storage to extract sensitive information such as usernames and passwords or cookies.
This behavior is often commonly observed in credential stealing malware.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems), Parth-FourCore

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE AgentTesla Exfil Via SMTP
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw:
alert smtp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE AgentTesla Exfil Via SMTP"; flow:established,to_server; content:"|0d 0a|Time|3a 20|"; content:"
User Name|3a 20|"; distance:0; content:"
OSFullName|3a 20|"; distance:0; fast_pattern; reference:md5,b8b71fc1124765b75b3aa3be805e9d12; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2030171; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2020_05_18, deployment Perimeter, malware_family AgentTesla, confidence High, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2020_05_18;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SURICATA Applayer Detect protocol only one direction
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ip any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA Applayer Detect protocol only one direction"; flow:established; app-layer-event:applayer_detect_protocol_only_one_direction; flowint:applayer.anomaly.count,+,1; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2260002; rev:1;)
